TestCase.TestCase_Title: Rename variables in both administrator and user owned categories

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Create an administrator context called "AdminContext" and store it in D:\OrchestraFrameworkTests\Administrator
Create a "Category0" category within the "AdminContext" context
Create a variable "Variable0" within the "Category0" category
Click on the "File" menu and select "Save"
Select the user mode by clicking on the "Mode" menu and selecting "User"
Create a participation to the "AdminContext" administrator context called "Participation to AdminContext"
Create a "Category1" category within the "Participation to AdminContext" context
Create a variable "Variable0" within the "Category1" category
Click on the "File" menu and select "Save"
Select the administrator mode by clicking on the "Mode" menu and selecting "Administrator"
Click on the "Category0" category
In the variable viewer, right click on the "Variable0" and select "Edit"

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: An "Edit variable" dialog box pops up

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Fill the "Name:" textfield with value "RenamedVariable"
Click on the "Finish" button

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The "Edit variable" dialog box disappears. The "Variable0" variable has been renamed to "RenamedVariable" in the variable viewer

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Click on the "File" menu and select "Save"
Select the user mode by clicking on the "Mode" menu and selecting "User"
Unfold the "Participation to AdminContext" context in the context viewer
Click on the "Category1" category
In the variable viewer, right click on the "Variable0" and select "Edit"

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: An "Edit variable" dialog box pops up

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Fill the "Name:" textfield with value "RenamedVariable"
Click on the "Finish" button

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The "Edit variable" dialog box disappears. The "Variable0" variable of the "Category1" category has been renamed to "RenamedVariable" in the variable viewer

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Create an administrator context called "AdminContext" and store it in D:\OrchestraFrameworkTests\Administrator
Create a "Category0" category within the "AdminContext" context
Create a variable "Variable0" within the "Category0" category
Click on the "File" menu and select "Save"
Create an administrator context called "InheritedAdminContext" with "AdminContext" as parent context and store it in D:\OrchestraFrameworkTests\Administrator
Select the administrator mode by clicking on the "Mode" menu and selecting "Administrator"
Unfold the "InheritedAdminContext" context in the context viewer
Click on the "Category0" category
In the variable viewer, right click on the "Variable0" and select "Edit"

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: An "Edit overriding variable" dialog box pops up. The "Name:" textfield is not editable

TestCase.TestCase_Objective: Cannot rename administrator variable in user mode

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Create an administrator context called "AdminContext" and store it in D:\OrchestraFrameworkTests\Administrator
Create a "Category0" category within the "AdminContext" context
Create a variable "Variable0" within the "Category0" category
Click on the "File" menu and select "Save"
Select the user mode by clicking on the "Mode" menu and selecting "User"
Create a participation to the "AdminContext" administrator context called "Participation to AdminContext"
Select the user mode by clicking on the "Mode" menu and selecting "User"
Unfold the "Participation to AdminContext" context in the context viewer
Click on the "Category0" category
In the variable viewer, right click on the "Variable0" and select "Edit"

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: An "Edit overriding variable" dialog box pops up. The "Name:" textfield is not editable

TestCase.TestCase_Title: Cannot rename a variable to an existing variable name

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Create an administrator context called "AdminContext" and store it in D:\OrchestraFrameworkTests\Administrator
Create a "Category0" category within the "AdminContext" context
Create two variables "Variable0" and "Variable1" within the "Category0" category
Select the administrator mode by clicking on the "Mode" menu and selecting "Administrator"
Unfold the "AdminContext" context in the context viewer
Click on the "Category0" category
In the variable viewer, right click on the "Variable1" and select "Edit"

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: An "Edit variable" dialog box pops up

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Fill the "Name:" textfield with value "Variable0"

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: An error message "There are errors ! See decorated fields below." is displayed on top of the dialog box. An error icon is displayed on the left side of the "Name:" textfield. The "Finish" button is unavailable

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Prepare test
Create a new context 'C1'
Create a new 'V1' variable in the 'Orchestra' category
Edit 'V1' variable set its value to 'val1'
Create a new 'NewCategory' category
Create a new 'V2' variable in the 'NewCategory' category
Edit 'V2' variable and set its value to "before2-${odm:\Orchestra\V1}-after2"

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: In the variables viewer, its value is displayed as "before2-val1-after2"

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Create a new 'C2' context inheriting from C1
Create a new 'V3' variable in the 'NewCategory' category
Edit 'V3' variable and set its value to "before3-${odm:\Orchestra\V1}-after3"

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: In the variables viewer, its value is displayed as "before3-val1-after3"

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Create a new 'C3' context inheriting from 'C2'
Create a new 'V4' variable in the 'Orchestra' category
Edit 'V4' variable and set its value to "before4-${odm:\Orchestra\V1}-after4"

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: In the variables viewer, its value is displayed as "before4-val1-after4"

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Select 'File' menu and click on 'Save'
Administrator mode
Find variable usages
Click on the 'C1' context
Click on the 'Orchestra' category
Right click on the 'V1' variable and select 'Find usages' in the contextual menu

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: A "Find Usages" dialog box pops up The context tree contains three contexts: C1, C2, C3

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Click on the '+' icon to expand the contexts tree

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The C1 context contains a single variable V2 variable displayed in bold. The C2 context contains two variables V2 and V3 displayed in bold. The C3 context contains three variables V2, V3 and V4 displayed in bold.

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Rename variable
Click on the 'C1' context
Click on the 'Orchestra' category
In the variable viewer, click on the 'V1' variable and select 'Refactor' in the contextual menu, and select 'Rename...' in the sub-menu

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: A "Rename variable" wizard page is displayed

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: In the "Impacted variables" group, click on the '+' icon to expand the contexts tree

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The C1 context contains a single variable V2 variable displayed in bold. The C2 context contains two variables V2 and V3 displayed in bold. The C3 context contains three variables V2, V3 and V4 displayed in bold.

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Set "Name:" textfield value to "V2"

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: An error decorator is displayed on the left of the text field

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Move mouse cursor over the decorator

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: A tooltip message "Variable does already exist" is displayed

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Set "Name:" textfield value to "RenamedVariable"
Click on the "Finish" button

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: In the variable viewer, the 'V1' variable has been renamed to "RenamedVariable" The value of the 'V2' variable is "before2-val1-after2"

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: In 'NewCategory' category, edit variable 'V2'

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: Its value is "before2-${odm:\Orchestra\RenamedVariable}-after2"

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Click on the 'C2' context
Click on the 'Orchestra' category

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: In the variable viewer, the 'V1' variable has been renamed to "RenamedVariable"

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Click on the 'NewCategory' category

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The value of the 'V3' variable is "before3-val1-after3"

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Edit variable 'V3'

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: Its value is "before3-${odm:\Orchestra\RenamedVariable}-after3"

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Click on the 'C3' context
Click on the 'Orchestra' category
In the variable viewer, the 'V1' variable has been renamed to "RenamedVariable"

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The value of the 'V4' variable is "before4-val1-after4"

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Edit variable "V4"

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: Its value is "before4-${odm:\Orchestra\RenamedVariable}-after4"

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: User mode
Find usages
Switch to user mode
Create a participation on the 'C1' administrator context and call it 'P1'
Click on the 'Orchestra' category
Right click on the 'RenamedVariable' variable and select 'Find usages' in the contextual menu

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: A "Find Usages" dialog box pops up The context tree containsone participation: P1

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Click on the '+' icon to expand the contexts tree

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The P1 context contains a single variable 'V2' variable displayed in bold.

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Rename variable
Create a new 'PV1' variable in the 'Orchestra' category
Edit 'PV1' variable set its value to 'val1'
Create a new 'PV2' variable in the 'Orchestra' category
Edit 'PV2' variable and set its value to "before2-${odm:\Orchestra\PV1}-after2"

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: In the variables viewer, its value is displayed as "before2-val1-after2"

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Create a new 'PV3' variable in the 'Orchestra' category
Edit 'PV3' variable and set its value to "before3-${odm:\Orchestra\PV1}-after3"

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: In the variables viewer, its value is displayed as "before3-val1-after3"

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: In the variable viewer, click on the 'PV1' variable and select 'Refactor' in the contextual menu, and select 'Rename...' in the sub-menu

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: A "Rename variable" wizard page is displayed

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: In the "Impacted variables" group, click on the '+' icon to expand the contexts tree

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The 'P1' context contains two variables 'PV2' and 'PV3' displayed in bold.

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Set "Name:" textfield value to "RenamedPV1"
Click on the "Finish" button

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: In the variable viewer, the 'PV1' variable has been renamed to "RenamedPV1" The value of the 'V2' variable is "before2-val1-after2" The value of the 'V3' variable is "before3-val1-after3"

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Edit variable 'PV2'

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: Its value is "before2-${odm:\Orchestra\RenamedPV1}-after2"

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Edit variable 'PV3'

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: Its value is "before3-${odm:\Orchestra\RenamedPV1}-after3"

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Find usages of an overriding variable
Switch to administrator mode
Click on the 'C3' context
Click on the 'NewCategory' category

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The value of the 'V3' variable is "before3-val1-after3"

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Edit variable 'V3'

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: Its value is "before3-${odm:\Orchestra\RenamedVariable}-after3"

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Change value of 'V3' to ${odm:\NewCategory\V2}
Click on the "Finish" button

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The value of the 'V3' variable is "before2-val1-after2"

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: Right click on the 'V2' variable and select 'Find usages' in the contextual menu

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: A "Find Usages" dialog box pops up The context tree contains one context: C3

Step_Description.Step_Description_label: In the "Impacted variables" group, click on the '+' icon to expand the contexts tree

Step_ExpectedResult.Step_ExpectedResult_label: The C3 context contains a single variable V3 variable displayed in bold.
